__e: There must be some intelligence behind it.
I'll try to remember not to.
I'll go back to my room, get dressed and try and shake those fellows off... but I won't succeed.
Thank you, Mr Scott, I'll try not to take that personally.
Why, yes, I suppose I am... yes it's a way of looking at it, but I'll try not to look at it too often!
So I'll try not to be too long.
They haven't been getting that sort of treatment here and I for one intend to try to do something about it.
I'll try and do anything and be anything you want, if you'll only keep me, Miss Cuthbert.
Sir, I think I know what you're going to say... and I want you to know... that I will try to make Wendy as happy as I can.
I'll try and be what he loves to call me, "a little woman" and not be rough and wild, and do my duty here at home instead of always wanting to go to war to help Father.
I'll try to be a good husband to you and a good father to your children.
I'll try to be a good father to your children and a good husband to you.
Don't worry, I won't try it twice.
I'll try, I really will, only please do this for me now.
We'll try again in a minute.
I'll try to call tomorrow - ok - ya - bye.
Darling, I'll always try to make you as happy as your father wanted you to be.
I'll try to tell you everything, the way it all happened.
